page.title: 13Ecology in Blackburn
page.content: We find a variety of natural habitats within a short distance of Blackburn school,and consequently wild-life is surprisingly flourishing especially away from the main valley. Blackburn Brook flows only a few hundred metres from school.However the brook once the haunt of flashing blue kingfishers and darting carp,is now completely polluted allowing no life of any kind to exist beneath it's oily black,smelly surface.Only stunted trees and bushes are to be found on it's banks. This main valley has been heavily industrialised for over 60 years. Unfortunately dereliction is now appearing in the vally. The overgrown path and disused railway lines are an eyesore and show that nature is only slowly recovering from the ravages of heavy industrial use. Away from the main vally a pleasant
